articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Youth Day
Rodong Sinmun on Line of Economic Construction in Songun Era
6th National Program Contest in Educational Field Held
8th National Taekwon-do Championships for Jongilbong Cup Held
articles.content:
8th National Taekwon-do Championships for Jongilbong Cup Held 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The 8th National Taekwon-do Championships for Jongilbong Cup was held at the Taekwon-do Hall from August 22 to 26.
 It brought together at least 650 players and students selected from Taekwon-do groups and provincial Taekwon-do schools. They competed in sparring matches, pattern competitions, exhibitions for special technique, etc. and paduk games.
 The Taekwon-do championships were divided into adult and school youth and children categories. Players of the sports group of the Korean Taekwon-do Committee and the North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-do School each came first in total points.
 At the paduk games players of the sports group of the Korean Taekwon-do Committee and the South Hamgyong Provincial Taekwon-do School were placed first by giving full play to good teamwork and special skills such as correct number reading and application of reasonable methods.    
 A closing ceremony took place Friday.

articles.title: Reception Hosted by Head of Zambian Government Delegation
Japan LDP's Anti-DPRK Remarks Flailed
articles.content:
Japan LDP's Anti-DPRK Remarks Flailed 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The present DPRK-Japan relations are inching close to an extreme phase due to the Japanese reactionaries' frantic hostile policy toward the DPRK. They will have to own full responsibility for the undesirable consequences to be entailed by the worst deterioration of the bilateral relations, warns Minju Joson Saturday in a signed commentary.
 The Japan Liberal Democratic Party claimed that there can never be any normalization of the relations between Japan and the DPRK without a solution to the "abduction issue," proposing the application of economic sanctions against the DPRK as one of its important political commitments to stay in power, the commentary says, and goes on: The DPRK can never overlook the Japanese reactionaries' move to use its anti-DPRK conspiratorial plot for their wicked farce aimed at staying in power.
 There is no reason for them to pull up the DPRK as regards the heated scramble for power kicked off by the rejection of the bills related to the postal privatization. The reactionaries' recent manifestation of their hostile stand on the DPRK clearly reflects the wicked mentality of those accustomed to meeting their own interests at the sacrifice of others.    
 The approach taken by the LDP politicians towards the general election clearly shows the real picture of the Japanese politicaldom full of pseudo politicians who seek power only, utterly indifferent to the progress of the people and the country, the commentary says, urging the Japanese reactionaries to face up to the gravity of the situation and refrain from their rash acts.

articles.title: Seminar on Role of Political Parties in North and South of Korea in June 15 Era
U.S. Urged to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK 
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. chief executive appointed former presidential aide Lefkowitz as "envoy for the human rights issue of north Korea." Supporting this appointment, a spokesman for the White House said it would help somebody redouble his efforts to improve human rights situation and reinforce the U.S. efforts.
 In this regard Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in its signed commentary:
 The appointment proves that what the U.S. had said before its dialogue partner does not agree with what it has done later. This, at the same time, indicates that the U.S. policy to bring down the "system" in the DPRK has gone over to the phase of practice from the legislative phase.    
 Such U.S. behavior is a very disturbing act as it is little short of challenging the DPRK which has shown generous magnanimity and flexibility for a solution to the nuclear issue and an act of throwing a hurdle in the way of the six-party talks.
 The U.S. seems not to be interested in the dialogue and the settlement of the nuclear issue at all but more keen on standing in confrontation with the DPRK and bringing about a "regime change" and "bringing down the system" in the DPRK.
 If the U.S. persists in such behavior, it will compel the DPRK to change its mind. The U.S. should abolish at once such unreasonable post of "envoy" and abandon its ambition to "bring down system in the DPRK."

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Three Charters for Reunification
Zambian Government Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Zambian Government Delegation Leaves
      Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The Zambian government delegation led by Vice-President Lupando Mwape flew back on Aug. 27 after winding up its five-day DPRK visit.
 It was seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Suk, vice-minister of Agriculture, and officials concerned.    
  During its stay the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, enjoyed the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang",  went round the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification, the West Sea Barrage, the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway and the Tongdaewon Clothing Factory, etc.

articles.title: Thai Foreign Minister Here
articles.content:
Thai Foreign Minister Here
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Minister of Foreign Affairs of Thailand Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK and Thai FMs
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK and Thai FMs
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and Thai Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Saturday.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and on a series of issue

articles.title: MOU Signed between DPRK and Thai Foreign Ministries
articles.content:
MOU Signed between DPRK and Thai Foreign Ministries
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of understanding on negotiations and cooperation between foreign ministries of the DPRK and Thailand was signed in Pyongyang Saturday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from our side were Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, Vice-Foreign Minister Kim Yong Il and officials concerned and from the opposite side Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his party and Thai Ambassador to the DPRK Jullapong Nonsrichai.    
 The memorandum of understanding was inked by Paek Nam Sun and Kantathi Suphamongkhon, foreign ministers of the DPRK and Thailand.

articles.title: Greetings to Moldovan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Moldovan President
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Vladimir Woronin, president of Moldova, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished the president greater success in his responsible work for national stability and prosperity, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand in the future.

articles.title: S. Korean Party Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
S. Korean Party Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea led by Chairwoman Kim Hye Gyong left Pyongyang today.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, and officials concerned.    
 During its stay the delegation visited the building of the Central Committee of the KSDP and inspected the Ssuksom Revolutionary Site.

articles.title: Congratulations to Bulgarian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Bulgarian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Sergei Stanishev upon his appointment as prime minister of Bulgaria.
 Expressing the belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Bulgaria would continue to develop favorably in the future, too, the message wished the prime minister great success in his new job. 
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun extended congratulations to Ivailo Kalfin upon his appointment as foreign minister of Bulgaria.

articles.title: Chinese Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Chinese Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Wu Dawei arrived here Saturday.
 It was greeted at the airport by officials concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of the Chinese embassy.

articles.title: KDWU Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
KDWU Delegation Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union led by Pak Sun Hui, chairwoman of its Central Committee, left here Saturday to participate in the celebrations of the 10th anniversary of the 4th World Conference on Women to be held in Beijing.
 It was seen off at the airport by Ri Yong Hui, vice-chairwoman of the KDWU Central Committee, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Congratulations to Burundian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Burundian President
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Aug. 25 sent a congratulatory message to Pierre Nkurunziza upon his assumption of the important post of the president of Burundi.
 The message wished him great success in his responsible work to promote national reconciliation and unity and rebuild the economy of the country and expressed the conviction that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop still further.

articles.title: Congratulations to Sri Lankan FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Sri Lankan FM
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Anura Bandaranaike on being appointed as foreign minister of Sri Lanka.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished the foreign minister of Sri Lanka success in the new job.

articles.title: Congratulations to Tunisian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Tunisian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Abdel Wahab Abdallah upon his appointment as foreign minister of Tunisia.
 The message expressed the conviction that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop and sincerely wished him good health and success in the performance of his duty.

articles.title: S. Korean MBC President and Overseas Compatriots Here
articles.content:
S. Korean MBC President and Overseas Compatriots Here
    Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Choe Mun Sun, president of the MBC of south Korea, and his party and Ri Hak Yu, secretary general of the Society to Remember Rev. Son Jong Do, and his party arrived here Saturday.
 They were met at the airport by officials concerned.
